result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Douglas Andrew Pietrantonio

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed, Notice of Completion of Representation

Branch 36 for branch 21.  Defendant Douglas Andrew Pietrantonio in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Douglas Andrew Pietrantonio in custody.  Benjamin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case 18CF650 for the purposes of sentencing.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Douglas Andrew Pietrantonio not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: CFL.
HELD OFF THE RECORD. Case set for Plea and sentencing. Court in trial on another matter. Case adjourned for plea and sentencing, in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 18, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Douglas Andrew Pietrantonio not in court, in custody.  Kathryn E. Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
HELD OFF THE RECORD. Court in trial on another matter.   Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing in branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 27, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

SPIN: Case heard in Preliminary Court for Br. 21. 
Defendant Douglas Andrew Pietrantonio in court with Attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Douglas Andrew Pietrantonio in custody. John Flynn for Benjamin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called on the record for status following 18CF650.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 5, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring; release for legal.  Court reminders.  Level 5  Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $1000.00 and no Electronic Monitoring.

Defendant Douglas Andrew Pietrantonio in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Douglas Andrew Pietrantonio in custody.  Kristyn R Kuzniar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davis, Branch 21.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Status conference scheduled for February 20, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($750.00 signature bond) gj
JusticePoint Discharge Summary, received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial report dated 09-14-2016
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 750.00.

Attorney Angel Johnson in court.  Joshua Anthony Dryak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
  Case set for Scheduling Conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. On the State's motion, Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited.
JusticePoint Violation Report received and filed. Court will address at next court date.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with B.C.T. (DOB 5/12/86), or her children. Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Douglas Andrew Pietrantonio in court with attorney Steven Rees Wiechmann.  Defendant Douglas Andrew Pietrantonio in custody.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davis, Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for pretrial conference.  Defendant failing to appear.  On State's motion, Court ordered a bench warrant to issue, bond remains forfeited.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Douglas Andrew Pietrantonio not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Statements by defense counsel that defendant is in custody.  Defense motion to withdraw bench warrant not argued by the state.  Court withdraws bench warrant.  Defense requests a pretrial conference date.   Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 45.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 750.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court.  Nicolas Heitman for Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for pretrial conference.  Defendant failing to appear.  On State's motion, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identifed, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with BCT dob 5/12/86 or her children

Defendant Douglas Andrew Pietrantonio in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Douglas Andrew Pietrantonio in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
